reviews.review_msg: First semester was great. Loved learning about / doing analysis of Black American Music. Second semester on indigenous music was the worst. More opinion than facts. Minimal academia. Minimal Music. To top it off, I was one of the only people in these courses that was of non european background. I wanted to learn about Japanese & Brazilian music.

This teacher gave me a B but I'll still give them an A! They are awesome! They delivered a course in a brand new 2020 format like a rockstar and they communicated with every single student--engaged with their progress and motivated them to succeed. I have diverse learning needs and I still succeeded. Thank you! Would like to work with in the future

A very nice and kind professor. She tends to be little disorganized when it comes to schedule and assignments. Assignments were pretty easy. I found the lectures pretty boring, but I did learn a lot about Afro-futurism. I really liked the movie she picked, Black Panther for the assignment! One of the most memorable class I've taken this semester.
